definition: to keep/to preserve/extant/to remain (from the past)
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
retained earnings

sentences.english: In the case of a company higher retained earnings will result in a lower dividend paid out to shareholders.
sentences.chinese: 在如此高的公司將被調低留存收益發放股利給股東。

sentences.english: The re-inspection will only be conducted to the sampled samples the re-inspection result shall be final.
sentences.chinese: 複驗只對抽取留存的樣品，複驗結果爲最終依據。

sentences.english: Her spirit and compassion live on today.
sentences.chinese: 她的精神和悲天憫人至今仍留存於世。

sentences.english: The new booklet is also a renewed effort to preserve WMO history for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 這個新的小冊子也在努力將WMO的歷史留存於後世。

sentences.english: I have seen bricks amid the oak copse there.
sentences.chinese: 我還看見過橡樹林中留存着的磚頭。

sentences.english: They allow the male infants to live.
sentences.chinese: 他們留存了男孩的生命。

sentences.english: The re-inspection will only be conducted to the sampled samples and the re-inspection result shall be final.
sentences.chinese: 複驗只對抽取留存的樣品，複驗結果爲最終依據。

sentences.english: Shi Shahai retained the edge of many ancient streets.
sentences.chinese: 什剎海邊上留存着許多古老的街道。

sentences.english: The Testing center will preservers some samples for future reference.
sentences.chinese: 檢驗結束後，我中心將留存部分樣品備查。

sentences.english: We feel that the longer something lasts, the more value it has.
sentences.chinese: 我們感覺留存時間越長的東西，擁有的價值就越高。

sentences.english: Our retained profits will provide capital for the planned growth next year.
sentences.chinese: 我們的留存利潤將爲明年的擴張計劃提供資金。

sentences.english: Explain out without reserve the calligraphy magic power that China spreads fame the overseas.
sentences.chinese: 把中國名揚外洋的書法魅力絕不留存地解釋進去。

sentences.english: An original Ainu house has been relocated outside the museum for preservation.
sentences.chinese: 一間原始阿依努的屋子，被遷移到博物館外面留存。

sentences.english: Who says word of Tang poetry the Song Dynasty can keep Yu Yao's distant memory?
sentences.chinese: 誰說唐詩宋詞只能留存於遙遠的記憶？

sentences.english: Every household should assemble a disaster supplies kit and keep it up to date.
sentences.chinese: 每個家庭都應該備有一套災難用品裝備並一直留存。

sentences.english: But very few ancient written verdicts before Tang remain so that they were neglected.
sentences.chinese: 但唐代以前的判文留存極少，以至於被人忽略。

definition: remaining/extant
to conserve/to preserve/to keep/to save (a file etc) (computing)
to keep/to retain/to have reservations (about sth)/to hold back (from saying sth)/to put aside for later
to hold in storage/to retain/to harbor (feelings)/to entertain (sentiments)/(of abstract things) to exist/there is
to leave behind/to hand down
to remain in existence/to retain
to receive for storage/delivery of goods/to gather and store/to store safely/safe keeping
to survive (a serious accident)/survival
remainder/fractional part (after the decimal point)/unfinished
to sequester/to seal up (for safe keeping)/to freeze (an account)/to mothball
material object/concrete object/original object/in kind/object for practical use/definite thing/reality/matter (physics)
to deposit/to store/to leave in sb's care
to record/record (written account)/note-taker/record (in sports etc)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to settle/to precipitate (solid sediment out of a solution)
to lose/lost
intact/in good condition
